info.title: Desk365 API Reference
info.description:
Welcome to the Desk365 API program!

You can now integrate Desk365 with other applications using the Desk365 API.

If you are interested in using Microsoft Power Automate, Azure Logic Apps or Microsoft Power Apps, please check it out at: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/connectors/desk365/

All the API endpoints require you to pass your API Key in the authorization header.You can try out the API using the web interface below.
  • Click on the Authorize button to enter your API Key.
  • In each API endpoint, click 'Try it out', enter any input parameters if needed and then click 'Execute' to see the results from that endpoint.

For suggestions, questions or to report bugs, contact us at help@desk365.io.

put.description:
Request and Response objects contain fixed numerical values to indicate Priority.
  • For "Priority": Low=1, Medium=5, High=10, Urgent=20.

Request Object Customization:

  • Assign To, Group, Category and Subcategory can be updated to unassigned by sending '- -' as the input.
  • For first_replied_duration,first_assigned_duration,resolved_duration and closed_duration , the values are represented in minutes.
  • Ticket properties that are not required and that are not part of the request body will not be changed.
  • Please click on the model below to know more about the input JSON Object with ticket properties.

parameters.name: ticket_number
parameters.description: Ticket number to update the details of that ticket.

requestBody.description: A JSON Object with ticket properties.

put.description:
Request Object Customization:

  • Category properties that are not part of the request body will not be changed.
  • Please click on the model below to know more about the input JSON Object with KB category properties.
This API endpoint uses constant integers to represent predefined categories or states. Below is a summary of their meanings:
  • For "support_portal_visibility": 1 - "Not visible in the Support Portal", 2 - "All visitors to the Support Portal", 3 - "Only signed in users of the Support Portal", 4 - "Support Portal signed in users from specific companies"
  • For "agent_portal_visibility": 1 - "All agents", 2 - "All agents in my group(s)".

parameters.name: category_name
parameters.description: The name of the category.

requestBody.description: A JSON Object with update category properties.

put.description:
Response object contains fixed numerical values to indicate bill_cycle, contract_type and rollover_type.

  • For "bill_cycle": Monthly = 1, Contract Length=2.
  • For "contract_type": Block Hours = 2, Block Tickets = 3.
  • For "rollover_type": Monthly = 1.

Request Object Customization:

  • Contract category can be updated to unassigned by sending '- -' as the input.
  • Contract properties that are not required and that are not part of the request body will not be changed.
  • If there are multiple contracts with the same name, a reference number is required for identification purposes.
  • Please click on the model below to know more about the input JSON Object with contract properties.

parameters.name: contract_name
parameters.description: The name of the contract.

parameters.name: reference_number
parameters.description: The reference number of the contract.

requestBody.description: A JSON Object with contract properties.

post.description:
Request and Response objects contain fixed numerical values to indicate Priority.

  • For "Priority": Low=1, Medium=5, High=10, Urgent=20.

Response object contains fixed numerical value to indicate Source.

  • For "Source": Email=1, Microsoft Teams=5, Support Portal=6, Phone or Other=7, Web Form=12, Web Widget=13, API=15.
  • For first_replied_duration,first_assigned_duration,resolved_duration and closed_duration , the values are represented in minutes.

Request Object Customization:

  • If you have set up custom ticket fields, use the same name along with the matching case here in "custom_fields" object of the request body to fetch the right results.
  • If you haven't set up any custom ticket fields, remove the "custom_fields" object in the request body and proceed.
  • If you want to use a specific ticket form in the Agent Portal, specify the "form_name" in the object of the request body.
  • If the "form_name" is not specified, the default Agent Portal form will be used to create the ticket.
  • Ticket properties that are not part of the request body will not be changed.

Attachments:

  • Only files on your local machine can be attached using API.
  • The Content-Type of the request should always be 'multipart/form-data'.
  • If you need to attach multiple files, the 'files' parameter should be used instead of 'file'.
  • Sample curl command for 'files' instead of 'file':
curl -X POST "https://apps.desk365.io/apis/tickets/create_with_attachment" -H "accept: */*" -H "Authorization: YourAPIKey" -H "Content-Type: multipart/form-data" -F "files=@path/to/File1.png" -F "files=@path/to/File2.txt" -F "files=@path/to/File3.pdf" -F "ticket_object = "{\"email\": \"contact@contoso.com\", \"form_name\": \"Create Ticket\", \"subject\": \"Printer not working\", \"description\": \"Please fix it\", \"status\": \"open\", \"priority\": 1, \"type\": \"Question\", \"assign_to\": \"agent@contoso.com\", \"group\": \"Sales\", \"category\": \"Billing\", \"sub_category\": \"Disputed Charge\", \"custom_fields\": {\"department\": \"string\", \"dob\": \"string\", \"employee_id\": 0}, \"watchers\": [\"johndoe@contoso.com\"], \"share_to\": [\"johndoe@contoso.com\"]}"

parameters.name: ticket_object
parameters.description:
Sample ticket object :
{"email":"contact@contoso.com", "form_name":"Create Ticket", "subject":"Printer not working", "description":"Please fix it", "status":"open", "priority":1, "type":"Question", "assign_to":"agent@contoso.com", "group":"Sales", "category":"Billing", "sub_category":"Disputed Charge", "custom_fields": {"department":"string", "dob":"string", "employee_id":0}, "watchers": ["johndoe@contoso.com"], "share_to": ["johndoe@contoso.com"]}

404.description: The resource you were trying to reach is not found

403.description: Accessing the resource you were trying to reach is forbidden

post.summary: Add reply to a ticket with attachment
post.description:
Request and Response objects contain fixed numerical values as follows.

  • For "include_prev_ccs": 0 - do not notify previously added CC email addresses in the ticket conversation, 1 - notify previously added CC email addresses in the ticket conversation
  • For "include_prev_messages": 0 - do not include previous messages in the ticket conversation, 1 - include previous messages in the ticket conversation

Request Object Customizations:

  • By default, the previous CCs will not be notified. If you wish to notify previous CCs, set the 'include_prev_ccs' property to 1.
  • By default, the previous messages will not be included. If you wish to include previous messages, set the 'include_prev_messages' property to 1.

Attachments:

  • Only files on your local machine can be attached using API.
  • The Content-Type of the request should always be 'multipart/form-data'.
  • If you need to attach multiple files, the 'files' parameter should be used instead of 'file'.
  • Sample curl command for 'files' instead of 'file':
curl -X POST "https://apps.desk365.io/apis/tickets/add_reply_with_attachment" -H "accept: */*" -H "Authorization: YourAPIKey" -H "Content-Type: multipart/form-data" -F "files=@path/to/File1.png" -F "files=@path/to/File2.txt" -F "files=@path/to/File3.pdf" -F "ticket_number=465" -F "reply_object={\"body\": \"We are working on this issue. Will keep you updated.\", \"cc_emails\": \"jon@contoso.com\", \"bcc_emails\": \"jon@contoso.com\", \"agent_email\": \"agent@contoso.com\", \"from_email\": \"support@domain.desk365.io\", \"include_prev_ccs\": 0, \"include_prev_messages\": 0}"

parameters.name: ticket_number
parameters.description: Ticket number to add reply to that ticket.

parameters.name: reply_object
parameters.description:
Sample reply object :
{"body": "We are working on this issue. Will keep you updated.", "cc_emails":"jon@contoso.com", "bcc_emails":"jon@contoso.com", "agent_email":"agent@contoso.com", "from_email":"support@domain.desk365.io", "include_prev_ccs":0, "include_prev_messages":0}

post.summary: Add note to a ticket with attachment
post.description:
Request and Response objects contain fixed numerical values to indicate whether it is a private or public note.

  • 0 - Public note, 1 - Private note

Request Object Customizations:

  • By default, any note that you add will be private. If you wish to add a public note, set the 'private_note' property to 0

Attachments:

  • Only files on your local machine can be attached using API.
  • The Content-Type of the request should always be 'multipart/form-data'.
  • If you need to attach multiple files, the 'files' parameter should be used instead of 'file'.
  • Sample curl command for 'files' instead of 'file':
curl -X POST "https://apps.desk365.io/apis/tickets/add_note_with_attachment" -H "accept: */*" -H "Authorization: YourAPIKey" -H "Content-Type: multipart/form-data" -F "files=@path/to/File1.png" -F "files=@path/to/File2.txt" -F "files=@path/to/File3.pdf" -F "ticket_number=465" -F "note_object={\"body\": \"We are working on this issue. Will keep you updated.\", \"agent_email\": \"agent1@contoso.com\", \"notify_emails\": \"agent2@contoso.com\", \"private_note\": 1}"

parameters.name: ticket_number
parameters.description: Ticket number to add reply to that ticket.

parameters.name: note_object
parameters.description:
Sample note object :
{"body":"We are working on this issue. Will keep you updated.", "agent_email":"agent1@contoso.com", "notify_emails":"agent2@contoso.com", "private_note":1}

404.description: The resource you were trying to reach is not found

403.description: Accessing the resource you were trying to reach is forbidden

500.description: Application failed to process the request

200.description: Successfully added a note to the ticket

post.description:
Request and Response objects contain fixed numerical values to indicate bill_cycle, contract_type and rollover_type.

  • For "bill_cycle": Monthly = 1, Contract Length=2.
  • For "contract_type": Block Hours = 2, Block Tickets = 3.
  • For "rollover_type": Monthly = 1.

Request Object Customization:

  • If the contract_type value is set to 2, you should use only the block_hours object and remove the block_tickets object from the request body.
  • If the contract_type value is set to 3, you should use only the block_tickets object and remove the block_hours object from the request body.
  • Please click on the model below to know more about the input JSON Object with contract properties.

requestBody.description: A JSON Object with contract properties.

get.description:
Default response is to list all the time entries. There are eight optional fields that can be used while calling this endpoint:
  1. agent_email - When provided, only time entries that are associated with this agent will be returned.

  2. billable - You can use this field to filter the time entries based on whether the time entry is billable or not.

  3. company_name - When provided, only time entries that are associated with this company will be returned.

  4. offset - Paginate through the resulting time entries list using this field.

  5. started_after - When provided, only time entries that were started after this time will be returned.

  6. started_before - When provided, only time entries that were started before this time will be returned.

  7. created_after - When provided, only time entries that were created after this time will be returned.

  8. updated_after - When provided, only time entries that were updated after this time will be returned.

  9. ticket_number - When provided, only time entries of this ticket will be returned.

  10. time_entries_count - By default you will retrieve 30 time_entries per API call. You can customize the count to retrieve 30, 50 or 100 time_entries per call.

  11. timer_running - You can use this field to filter the time entries based on whether the time entry is currently running or not.

parameters.name: ticket_number
parameters.description: Unique ID of the ticket.

parameters.name: time_entries_count
parameters.description: Select number of time_entries to retrieve per call.

parameters.name: agent_email
parameters.description: The email address of the agent to whom the time entry is associated.

parameters.name: company_name
parameters.description: The name of the company.

parameters.name: started_before
parameters.description: Get a list of time entries started before the specified time yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss.

parameters.name: started_after
parameters.description: Get a list of time entries started after the specified time yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss.

parameters.name: created_after
parameters.description: Get a list of time entries created after the specified time yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss.

parameters.name: updated_after
parameters.description: Get a list of time entries updated after the specified time yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss.

parameters.name: billable
parameters.description: 0 - Non Billable, 1 - Billable

parameters.name: timer_running
parameters.description: 0 - Timer is not running, 1 - Timer is running

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Get next 30 time entries from the offset value

404.description: The resource you were trying to reach is not found

403.description: Accessing the resource you were trying to reach is forbidden

500.description: Application failed to process the request

401.description: You are not authorized to access the resource

get.description:
Default response is to list all tickets ordered by the created date in descending order without description. There are nine optional fields that can be used while calling this endpoint:
  1. ticket_count - By default you will retrieve 30 tickets per API call. You can customize the count to retrieve 30, 50 or 100 tickets per call.

  2. offset - Paginate through the resulting ticket list using this field.

  3. include_description - By default, description is not included in the response. You can include description in the response using this field.

  4. include_custom_fields - If you use custom ticket fields, you can add them to the response using this field.

  5. include_survey_details - By default, survey ratings are not included in the response. You can include it in the response using this field. 'survey_ratings' is populated only if the survey is sent. If there are multiple ratings for a ticket, the latest survey rating is populated.

  6. nested_fields - If you do not want custom fields and survey details in a nested structure, set this to 1.

  7. order_by - Indicates the sorting criteria.

  8. order_type - ascending or descending.

  9. updated_since - When provided, only tickets that were updated after this time will be returned.

  10. filters - Filter the tickets based on 'status', 'priority', 'type', 'group', 'assigned_to', 'category', 'subcategory', 'source' and 'contact'. The 'filters' object should contain an array of string values enclosed in double quotes. Ensure that double quotes, single quotes, and backslashes within the strings are properly escaped with a backslash (\\).

    • Use "--" to indicate an unassigned value for the filter
    • Omit fields from the filter if you prefer not to include them in the filtering process

    Sample filters: 

    {
    "status": ["Open", "Pending"],
    "priority": ["1", "10"],
    "type": ["Printer \\'Out of Ink\\' Complaint", "Customer\\'s Request"],
    "group": ["\\"Sales\\" Department", "\\"Marketing\\" Department"],
    "assigned_to": ["user1@example.com", "user2@example.com"],
    "category": ["Hardware", "Software"],
    "subcategory": ["Printer", "Laptop"],
    "source": ["1", "6"],
    "contact": ["customer1@example.com", "customer2@example.com"]
}

    More information on use of filters can be found here


Response contains fixed numerical values for the below fields:

  • For "Priority": Low=1, Medium=5, High=10, Urgent=20.
  • For "Source": Email=1, Microsoft Teams=5, Support Portal=6, Phone or Other=7, Web Form=12, Web Widget=13, API=15.
  • For first_replied_duration,first_assigned_duration,resolved_duration and closed_duration , the values are represented in minutes.
  • For "sv_type": Customer Satisfaction = 1, Five Star Rating = 2, Net Promoter Score = 3.
  • For "sv_cs_neutral_type": 'Neither satisfied nor dissatisfied' should be categorized as Positive = 1, Neutral = 2, Negative = 3.
  • For "sv_cs_ratings": Possible values are -3, -2, -1, 0, 1, 2, 3. The text mapped to these values can be retrieved from survey details endpoint for the survey type 'Customer Satisfaction' using sv_name.
  • For "conversation_count":Total number of ticket conversations including notes, replies, and forwarded messages.

parameters.name: ticket_count
parameters.description: Select number of tickets to retrieve per call.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Get next 30, 50 or 100 tickets from offset value based on selected ticket_count.

parameters.name: include_description
parameters.description: 0 - do not include description, 1 - include description in the result.

parameters.name: include_custom_fields
parameters.description: 0 - do not include, 1 - include custom fields in the result.

parameters.name: include_survey_details
parameters.description: 0 - do not include survey details, 1 - include survey detials in the result.

parameters.name: nested_fields
parameters.description: 0 - nested, 1 - not nested

parameters.name: order_by
parameters.description: created_time - sort by created time, updated_time - sort by updated time

parameters.name: order_type
parameters.description: asc - sort in ascending order, desc - sort in descending order

parameters.name: updated_since
parameters.description: Get a list of tickets that have shown any activity since the specified time yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss.

parameters.name: filters
parameters.description: Sample filters : {"status": ["Open", "Pending"], "priority": ["1", "10"], "type": ["Printer \\'Out of Ink\\' Complaint", "Customer\\'s Request"], "group": ["\\"Sales\\" Department", "\\"Marketing\\" Department"], "assigned_to": ["user1@example.com", "user2@example.com"], "category": ["Hardware", "Software"], "subcategory": ["Printer", "Laptop"], "source": ["1", "6"], "contact": ["customer1@example.com", "customer2@example.com"]}

404.description: The resource you were trying to reach is not found

403.description: Accessing the resource you were trying to reach is forbidden

500.description: Application failed to process the request

401.description: You are not authorized to access the resource

get.description:
Get all the ticket details for a given ticket number

Response contains fixed numerical values to indicate Priority and Source.
  • For "Priority": Low=1, Medium=5, High=10, Urgent=20.
  • For "Source": Email=1, Microsoft Teams=5, Support Portal=6, Phone or Other=7, Web Form=12, Web Widget=13, API=15.
  • For first_replied_duration,first_assigned_duration,resolved_duration and closed_duration , the values are represented in minutes.

parameters.name: ticket_number

get.description:
Get all the ticket conversations for a given ticket number

Request Object Customization:

  • By default, the conversations are sorted by earliest conversation first. If you wish to sort by latest conversation first, set the 'sort_by' property to 'latest_on_top'.
  • By default, the contact replies are included. If you wish to exclude the contact replies, set the 'include_contact_replies' property to 0.
  • By default, the agent replies are included. If you wish to exclude the agent replies, set the 'include_agent_replies' property to 0.
  • By default, the private notes are included. If you wish to exclude the private notes, set the 'include_private_notes' property to 0.
  • By default, the public notes are included. If you wish to exclude the public notes, set the 'include_public_notes' property to 0.
  • By default, the forwarded messages are included. If you wish to exclude the forward messages, set the 'include_forward_messages' property to 0.

Response contains possible values for the below fields:

  • "sender_type": "agent" or "contact".

parameters.name: ticket_number
parameters.description: Ticket number to get the conversations of that ticket.

parameters.name: sort_by
parameters.description: earliest_on_top - sort by earliest conversation first, latest_on_top - sort by latest conversation first

parameters.name: include_contact_replies
parameters.description: 1 - include contact replies, 0 - do not include contact replies

parameters.name: include_agent_replies
parameters.description: 1 - include agent replies, 0 - do not include agent replies

parameters.name: include_private_notes
parameters.description: 1 - include private notes, 0 - do not include private notes

parameters.name: include_public_notes
parameters.description: 1 - include public notes, 0 - do not include public notes

parameters.name: include_forward_messages
parameters.description: 1 - include forward messages, 0 - do not include forward messages

get.description:
Default response is to list all surveys ordered by their creation time in ascending order.

This API endpoint contains fields that use constant integers to represent specific predefined categories or states within the system. The following is a detailed explanation of the constants and their meanings:

  • For "survey_type": Customer Satisfaction = 1, Five Star Rating = 2, Net Promoter Score = 3.
  • For "cs_rating_order": Good to Bad = 1, Bad to Good = 2
  • For "cs_neutral_type": 'Neither satisfied nor dissatisfied' should be categorized as Positive = 1, Neutral = 2, Negative = 3.
  • For "notify_type": Ticket resolved = 7, Ticket closed = 8

get.description:
Default response is to list all contracts ordered by the contract name in alphabetical order. There are six optional fields that can be used while calling this endpoint:


  1. contract_category - When provided, only the contracts that belong to this category will be returned.

  2. company - When provided, only the contracts that belong to this company will be returned.

  3. include_expired_contracts - By default, all contracts will be returned including expired ones. If you want to remove the expired contracts from the response, you can set the value of this field to 0.

  4. include_inactive_contracts - By default, all contracts will be returned including inactive ones. If you want to remove the inactive contracts from the response, you can set the value of this field to 0.

  5. include_upcoming_contracts - By default, all contracts will be returned including upcoming ones. If you want to remove the upcoming contracts from the response, you can set the value of this field to 0.

  6. offset - Paginate through the resulting contract list using this field.

Response object contain fixed numerical values to indicate bill_cycle, contract_type and rollover_type.

  • For "bill_cycle": Monthly = 1, Contract Length=2.
  • For "contract_type": Block Hours = 2, Block Tickets = 3.
  • For "rollover_type": Monthly = 1.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Get next 30 contracts from offset value.

parameters.name: company
parameters.description: Enter the company name to get the contracts associated with the company.

parameters.name: contract_category
parameters.description: Enter the category name to get the contracts from the category.

parameters.name: include_inactive_contracts
parameters.description: 0 - do not include inactive contracts, 1 - include inactive contracts in the result.

parameters.name: include_expired_contracts
parameters.description: 0 - do not include expired contracts, 1 - include expired contracts in the result.

parameters.name: include_upcoming_contracts
parameters.description: 0 - do not include upcoming contracts, 1 - include upcoming contracts in the result.

Response object contains fixed numerical values to indicate bill_cycle, contract_type and rollover_type.

  • For "contract_type": Block Hours = 2, Block Tickets = 3.
  • For "rollover_type": Monthly = 1.

get.description:
Default response is to list all contacts ordered by the contact name in ascending order. There are four optional fields that can be used while calling this endpoint:
  1. company - If you want to retrieve the contacts belong to a specific company, you can do so by specifying the company name in this field.

  2. offset - Paginate through the resulting contact list using this field.

  3. order_by - Indicates the sorting criteria.

  4. order_type - ascending or descending.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Get next 30 contacts from offset value.

parameters.name: company
parameters.description: Enter the company name to get the contacts belong to this company.

parameters.name: order_by
parameters.description: 1 - sort by name, 2 - sort by title, 3 - sort by company name, 4 - sort by email

parameters.name: order_type
parameters.description: asc - sort in ascending order, desc - sort in descending order

APIKey.description:
Please ensure you are accessing the Desk365 API documentation under your designated subdomain. Your API key will only work when using with your own subdomain.
For example: https://<<yoursubdomain>>.desk365.io/apis/api-docs.html
APIKey.name: Authorization
